sentence.text: Targeted resequencing was used to screen 460 unselected epilepsy patients for variants in chemical synaptic transmission.

The purpose of this study was to determine the incidence of SLC6A1 variants in 460 unselected epilepsy patients and to evaluate the negative regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II of the identified variants on Î³-aminobutyric acid (GABA)transport.

entity.text: negative regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II

sentence.text: Previous reports have identified chemical synaptic transmission variants in patients with generalized epilepsies, such as myoclonic-atonic epilepsy and childhood absence epilepsy.

These findings demonstrate that SLC6A1 is an important contributor to childhood epilepsy and that reduced glycine metabolic process-1 function is a common consequence of epilepsy-causing SLC6A1 variants
